alert.note: Alert for Coastal Hancock; Coastal Washington (Maine) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued August 31 at 6:09AM EDT until August 31 at 1:00PM EDT by NWS Caribou
info.description: ...HIGH SURF ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 11 PM EDT THIS EVENING... ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 1 PM THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...For the High Surf Advisory, large breaking waves of 4 to 6 feet in the surf zone. For the Coastal Flood Statement, minor overwash is expected on vulnerable low lying roads along the immediate coast. * WHERE...Coastal Hancock and Coastal Washington Counties. * WHEN...For the High Surf Advisory, until 11 PM EDT this evening. For the Coastal Flood Statement, from 10 AM this morning to 1 PM EDT this afternoon. * IMPACTS...High dangerous surf and strong rip currents will make for hazardous surf conditions. Large waves can present a danger to people on rocks above the water. Stay away from rock outcrops along the shoreline exposed to ocean waves, as waves can easily sweep people into the cold ocean water. Water may begin to approach the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and piers. Low-lying causeways will have some minor splash-over, but inundation is not expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Minor overwash will be possible around the time of high tide this morning around 1130 am.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways. A high surf advisory means that high surf will affect beaches in the advisory area...producing rip currents and localized beach erosion.
